name: py-biobb-gromacs

variants.name: build_system
variants.description: Build systems supported by the package

description:
Biobb_gromacs is the Biobb module collection to perform molecular
dynamics simulations using the GROMACS MD suite

dependencies.name: gromacs
dependencies.description:
GROMACS is a molecular dynamics package primarily designed for
simulations of proteins, lipids and nucleic acids. It was originally
developed in the Biophysical Chemistry department of University of
Groningen, and is now maintained by contributors in universities and
research centers across the world. GROMACS is one of the fastest and
most popular software packages available and can run on CPUs as well as
GPUs. It is free, open source released under the GNU Lesser General
Public License. Before the version 4.6, GROMACS was released under the
GNU General Public License.

dependencies.name: py-biobb-common
dependencies.description: Biobb_common is the base package required to use the biobb packages

dependencies.name: py-pip
dependencies.description: The PyPA recommended tool for installing Python packages.

dependencies.name: py-setuptools
dependencies.description:
A Python utility that aids in the process of downloading, building,
upgrading, installing, and uninstalling Python packages.

dependencies.name: python-venv
dependencies.description: A Spack managed Python virtual environment
